metadata.title: CVE-2019-14897 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A stack-based buffer overflow was found in the Linux kernel, versionkernel-2.6.32, in Marvell WiFi chip driver. An attacker is able to cause adenial of service (system crash) or, possibly execute arbitrary code, whena STA works in IBSS mode (allows connecting stations together without theuse of an AP) and connects to another STA.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14897` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
